page.title: 09HOME LIFE
page.content: Thw majority of people here are Americans living at RAF Woodbridge. Despite cultural differences, their family life is very similar to the local population. Most families eat breakfast "on the run" in that members of the family go to work & school at different times.It is usually a tradi- tional meal of cereal, toast, tea or coffee.An important time for most fam- ilies is evening when a meal is taken together and the day's activities dis- cussed. Even though American eating habits in the USA differ from ours, here they seem to adopt the British tradition of meat or fish taken with vegetables. There are various ethnic groups within the community & this is reflected in the food available at the commissary, i.e. Italian, Mexican and Jewish products.Barbecues are popular in the summer, weather permitting!
